column2: MISSISSIPPI DMV DRIVING TEST
column6: MS

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column6: You.

column2: 2. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column6: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column8: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.

column2: 3. ABS is the acronym for:
column6: Anti-Braking System

column2: 4. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.
column6: always stop at the crosswalk.
column8: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

column2: 5. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 6. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 7. Warning signs normally are:
column6: rectangles.

column2: 8. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 9. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 10. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column6: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.
column8: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.

column2: 11. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column6: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column8: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 12. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column6: Try to move away safely.

column2: 13. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.
column6: As far to the right as possible.

column2: 14. If you are feeling tired while driving, you should:
column6: stop and get some rest.

column2: 15. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column6: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column8: be ready to shift to lower gear.

column2: 16. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column6: Never.

column2: 17. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
column6: help create a safe driving environment.

column2: 18. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column6: brown and white.

column2: 19. A red traffic sign means?
column6: Do not enter.

column2: 20. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: Reversible lane ahead.

column2: 21. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: Slow down, slippery when wet

column2: 23. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column8: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 24. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column6: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 25. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is about to stop.
column6: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column8: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.

column2: 26. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: when a child is about to run into the street.
column6: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.

column2: 27. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column6: Drivers who are driving alone.

column2: 28. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 29. When the road is slippery, drivers should _________ their following distance.
column6: increase

column2: 30. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
